intro: Epipactis atrorubens f. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved purple orchid, is a rare and specialized orchid species found in specific habitats across Europe. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and striking purple flowers with a distinctive hooded lip. The plant is adapted to grow in shaded, moist environments, often in woodland or rocky areas. Its flowers are pollinated by specific insects, highlighting its ecological niche. Due to habitat loss, it is considered vulnerable, making conservation efforts essential for its survival.
